pullRequest.body:
This adds some API lemmas for multiplicative characters. We also remove a couple of porting notes (the previous proof lines work again).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
> we should move it to somewhere in the algebra hierarchy.

I'm planning to move `MulCharacter` to `NumberTheory.MulChar.Basic` (and add more API in a new `Lemmas` file); see [here on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2313392.20Multiplicative.20characters/near/441938998). I'm also going to move `GaussSum` directly under `NumberTheory` (the original development was motivated by quadratic reciprocity, but Gauss sums are more generally uesful) and eventually add `NumberTheory.JacobiSum` as well.

> Gauss sums are more generally useful

I agree strongly! So you're saying this move will follow in a future PR?

> this file imports `Mathlib.Algebra.EuclideanDomain.Instances`

I have removed the import. Thanks for spotting this!

LGTM! 

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9388348275/job/25853387752)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9388348275/job/25853387163)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I left some minor comments. I feel `LegendreSymbol` isn't the best place for this though; we should move it to somewhere in the algebra hierarchy. 

Incidentally, this file imports `Mathlib.Algebra.EuclideanDomain.Instances` but seems to compile fine with that import removed; getting rid of that will make it much easier to relocate without introducing undesirable imports (= upsetting Yael).

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Can you just put all the universes immediately after the module doc comment?
I'm replacing them all by `Type*`.
It is not clear to me what this note complains about, so I'm removing it.

🏌️ 
```suggestion
  a.isUnit.map χ <| 
```
I'm also not particularly fond of the formulation – its input is a bundled `Unit` (a type) but its output is an `IsUnit` (a Prop). You can reserve the inconsistency by having `IsUnit` as input and output, but then it's just duplicating `IsUnit.map` which works for any MonoidHomClass.
It is sometimes convenient, though.
Can you give a use case for this lemma where other existing lemmas, e.g. `IsUnit.map`, don't already achieve the same thing with equivalent or shorter code? I couldn't find one.
OK, I guess you are right. In my use case, I actually need the unit `χ a`, which is `equivToUnitHom χ a`, and so I can easily get rid of this lemma.

Generally I feel that if you're having to use `change` it means there's a simp lemma missing. Perhaps something like
```lean
lemma MonoidHom.pow_apply {U V : Type*} [CommMonoid U] [CommMonoid V] 
    (f : U →* V) (n : ℕ) (u : U) :
    (f ^ n) u = (f u) ^ n :=
  rfl
```
I've added this as a `simp` lemma now.

```suggestion
/-- If `χ` is a multiplicative character on a finite commutative monoid `M`, then `χ ^ #Mˣ = 1`. -/
```
(more readable)
`... of_odd_order` maybe? The terminology of "even" vs "odd" Dirichlet characters is well established, and the present lemma name risks confusion as a result.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add API for multiplicative characters

nodes.body:
I left some minor comments. I feel `LegendreSymbol` isn't the best place for this though; we should move it to somewhere in the algebra hierarchy. 

Incidentally, this file imports `Mathlib.Algebra.EuclideanDomain.Instances` but seems to compile fine with that import removed; getting rid of that will make it much easier to relocate without introducing undesirable imports (= upsetting Yael).

> we should move it to somewhere in the algebra hierarchy.

I'm planning to move `MulCharacter` to `NumberTheory.MulChar.Basic` (and add more API in a new `Lemmas` file); see [here on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2313392.20Multiplicative.20characters/near/441938998). I'm also going to move `GaussSum` directly under `NumberTheory` (the original development was motivated by quadratic reciprocity, but Gauss sums are more generally uesful) and eventually add `NumberTheory.JacobiSum` as well.

> Gauss sums are more generally useful

I agree strongly! So you're saying this move will follow in a future PR?

> this file imports `Mathlib.Algebra.EuclideanDomain.Instances`

I have removed the import. Thanks for spotting this!
